page.title: 10FARMING THROUGH THE YEAR
page.content: July-August. Farmers cut oil seed rape and winter barley and wheat,and plough the stubble.They sow winter oil seed rape and put in grass seed. End September. They sow winter barley. Early October. The cattle come in for the winter, and they sow winter wheat and spray the oil seed rape. Early November. They spray all winter barley and wheat for grass weeds. End February. Depending on the weather,they put fertiliser on oil seed rape and barley. March. They sow winter wheat and fertilise the grass. April. They spray winter barley and wheat.May. They cut grass for silage ,for the first cut.May-June.They spray barley and wheat in order to prevent diseases and other pests.June-July. They cut grass for silage second cut.
